component_description: A UI placeholder to use when the data is empty or not available. An instruction or friendly message is usually shown here to guide user to the next action.

className.name: className
className.description: A space-delimited list of class names to pass along to the element.

style.name: style
style.description: Additional inline style to be applied for the most outer element of the component.

examples.example_description:
The most basic empty template.
```jsx live
<Empty text="Looking for an applicant tracking system? Employment Hero’s ATS software is a robust solution for total employee lifecycle management from Hiring and Onboarding to Off-boarding." />
```
examples.code: <Empty text="Looking for an applicant tracking system? Employment Hero’s ATS software is a robust solution for total employee lifecycle management from Hiring and Onboarding to Off-boarding." />
examples.purpose_description: The purpose of this example is to demonstrate the simplest usage of the 'Empty' component, which is likely designed to display a message or placeholder when there is no data or content to show. This basic example showcases how to use the component with a single 'text' prop to convey a message to the user.
examples.technical_description: The example uses the 'Empty' component with a single prop 'text'. This prop is a string that contains the message to be displayed. The component is likely designed to render this text in a styled manner, possibly with additional UI elements like icons or images to indicate the absence of content. The component is rendered using JSX, which is a syntax extension for JavaScript commonly used in React to describe what the UI should look like.
examples.patterns_description: This example demonstrates a common pattern in React of using components to encapsulate UI logic and presentation. By using a dedicated 'Empty' component, the implementation abstracts the details of how an empty state is presented, allowing for consistent styling and behavior across different parts of an application. This pattern promotes reusability and maintainability.
examples.use_cases_description: This example would be particularly useful in scenarios where an application needs to handle empty states gracefully. For instance, in a dashboard or data-driven application, when a user performs a search that yields no results, the 'Empty' component can be used to inform the user and possibly guide them towards other actions. It is also useful in onboarding flows or when certain features are not yet available, providing a placeholder message to users.

examples.example_description:
Empty can be rendered with a title.
```jsx live
<Empty
  extra={
    <Button icon="add" variant="filled" intent="primary" text="Create a goal" />
  }
  title="No goals created yet."
  text="Reach for the stars! Click 'Create a goal' button below to create your first goal."
/>
```
examples.code:
<Empty
  extra={
    <Button icon="add" variant="filled" intent="primary" text="Create a goal" />
  }
  title="No goals created yet."
  text="Reach for the stars! Click 'Create a goal' button below to create your first goal."
/>
examples.purpose_description: The purpose of this example is to demonstrate how the 'Empty' component can be used to display a message when there are no items or data to show, along with an action button to encourage user interaction. This is particularly useful in scenarios where a user might expect content but none is available yet, providing a clear call-to-action to create or add new content.
examples.technical_description: The 'Empty' component is rendered with three main props: 'extra', 'title', and 'text'. The 'extra' prop is used to pass additional elements or components, in this case, a 'Button' component. The 'Button' component is configured with several props to define its appearance and behavior, such as 'icon', 'variant', 'intent', and 'text'. The 'title' prop provides a heading for the empty state, while the 'text' prop gives additional context or instructions to the user. This setup ensures that the empty state is informative and actionable.
examples.patterns_description: This example demonstrates the use of composition in React, where components are composed together to build more complex UIs. The 'Empty' component acts as a container for other components, such as the 'Button'. It also follows the pattern of providing clear user feedback and guidance through titles and descriptive text, which is a best practice in UI/UX design. Additionally, the use of props to customize the behavior and appearance of components is a common React pattern.
examples.use_cases_description: This example is particularly useful in applications where users need to be guided to take action when no data is present. For instance, in a task management app, when no tasks are available, this component can prompt users to create a new task. It can also be used in dashboards, content management systems, or any application where initial user engagement is necessary to populate data or content.

examples.example_description:
By providing imageSrc prop.
```jsx live
<Empty
  imageSrc="data:image/jpeg;base64,"
  extra={
    <Button
      icon="add"
      variant="filled"
      intent="primary"
      text="Request a demo"
    />
  }
  text="Looking for an applicant tracking system? Employment Hero’s ATS software is a robust solution for total employee lifecycle management from Hiring and Onboarding to Off-boarding."
/>
```
examples.code:
<Empty
  imageSrc="data:image/jpeg;base64,"
  extra={
    <Button
      icon="add"
      variant="filled"
      intent="primary"
      text="Request a demo"
    />
  }
  text="Looking for an applicant tracking system? Employment Hero’s ATS software is a robust solution for total employee lifecycle management from Hiring and Onboarding to Off-boarding."
/>
examples.purpose_description: This React component example demonstrates how to customize the image displayed in an 'Empty' component by using the 'imageSrc' prop. The component is designed to show a custom image when there is no data to display, providing a more personalized user experience.
examples.technical_description: The component utilizes the 'Empty' component from a UI library, which is typically used to display a placeholder when there is no data available. The 'imageSrc' prop is used to specify a custom image in base64 format, allowing the developer to replace the default empty state image with a custom one. Additionally, the 'extra' prop is used to render a 'Button' component, which provides an interactive element for users to take further action, such as requesting a demo. The 'text' prop provides a descriptive message to guide the user.
examples.patterns_description: This example demonstrates the use of props to customize a component's appearance and behavior. The 'imageSrc' prop allows for dynamic customization of the component's visual representation, while the 'extra' prop showcases how to extend the component's functionality by embedding additional interactive elements. The use of base64 encoding for the image ensures that the image is self-contained within the component, eliminating external dependencies.
examples.use_cases_description: This example is particularly useful in scenarios where a web application needs to handle empty states gracefully. For instance, in a dashboard or data-driven application, when there are no records to display, this component can provide a visually appealing placeholder with a call-to-action button, encouraging users to take further steps, such as adding new data or requesting a demo. It enhances user experience by providing context and actionable options in situations where data is absent.
